intro: Duvaua patagonica, commonly known as the Patagonian dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. Duvaua patagonica is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
